result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronda Jane Langer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Cases Called @ 11:20 AM: Defendant Ronda Jane Langer in court with attorney Amanda Bellville and Atty J. Steven Heil.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Global resolution recited by ADA with argued terms on sentencing.  Def and Atty Heil confirm recital.  Atty Belville moves for withdrawal as Atty Heil will be assuming her representation.  Def agrees with withdrawal.  Court grants Atty Belville to withdraw at this time.  16CM-83:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per Atty Heil - matter will be resolved with a NC plea today.     Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  No impairment on proceeding today. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  One victim present which will wish to speak at the appropriate time.  16CM-83 - Plea Ct Nos 1 and 2:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  15CM-219 and 15CM-352 both DRI.   Statement by Victim J. Seegert.  Argument by ADA.  Argument by Atty Heil.  Statement by Def: Yes.  The Court:   Ct 1 - 6 mos WCJ - I/S.  Ct 2: 6 mos WCJ I/S consecutive to each other - S/W 2 yrs probation.  May petition for early termination of supervision if joined by agent at any time after completion of 1 yr.  Conditions:  Complete an AODA and any follow thru as deemed appropriate;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; the residence of where Def lives is to be free of any alcohol; follow thru with any grief counseling and/or therapy as agent deems appropriate; Court Costs plus DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court; no contact with Richard Okon and/or Raona Okon unless specifically authorized by supervising agent.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Appeal Rights Given.  10 days TS credit as to each of the two counts in the event of any revocation.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney J. Steven Heil in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Heil make statement regarding  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jodi Heil in court.  Scott Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Heil was retained by Ms. Langer - substitution of counsel not returned yet from Atty Johnson.  Atty Heil is still awaiting file materials from prior counsel.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 09:20 am.

11:22 pm cases called.  15CM219 & 15CM352. Attorney Genelle M. Johnson in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over request for substitution of counsel. Statement by Attorney Heil regarding substitution of counsel & requests a continuance of hearing to file substitution.  Status conference scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Take all prescribed medications by her medical professionals or treating medical professionals.  Defendant must participate in all recommended counseling and/or treatment prescribed by the medical professionals.

Case Called @ 2:20 PM: Defendant Ronda Jane Langer in court with attorney Genelle M. Johnson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CM-352:    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.   P/S scheduled with 15CM-219.   DA argues as to bond amendment for no contact provision with victim.  Atty Johnson does not object to bond modification.  Court will amend bond to include no contact provision with victim.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Take all prescribed medications by her medical professionals or treating medical professionals.  Defendant must participate in all recommended counseling and/or treatment prescribed by the medical professionals.

Case Called @ 1:05 PM: Defendant Ronda Jane Langer in court with attorney Eric R Heywood, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed - anticipates that Janelle Johnson will be appointed.  ADA argues as to bond request - small cash bond based upon violation.  SPD argues as to bond - only income is disability - argues for Signature Bond w/conditions.  The Court:  Orders a bond of $250.00 w/conditions.  IA adjourned to 9/11/2015 at 2:00 pm.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
